title: scroll bars cover website-widgets (check boxes) (110.0.1 64-Bit)
content:
scroll bars obscure website-widgets (check boxes) (110.0.1 64-Bit)!! e.g., when trying to activate a checkbox at the right edge (marking an item to cancel an order) that is not possible because the firefox scrollbar (right side) covers the checkbox, it is impossible to mark it, so the item cannot be cancelled!

This is an unacceptable malfunction!!

(OTOH, on MSEdge, the scrollbar sits to the right of the checkboxes without ever covering them, so it's obvious that this is specific Firefox malfunction!!!)
creator: dsyleixa

title: Me han desaparecido las contraseñas
content: Tengo la cuenta vinculada en Firefox con mi correo, en todos los dispositivos con las cuentas conectadas me salen todas las cuentas y contraseñas guardadas, en otro dispositivo inicio la sesión y no me aparecen nada más que las 4 cuentas que he podido iniciar sesión hoy pero no me aparecen todas las demás, ¿Alguna idea?
creator: danielpichu

title: Refreshed Mozilla
content:
Hi there,

I refreshed Mozilla Firefox because reCAPTCHA was not working client side. Doing this fixed that. HOWEVER, my passwords did not carry over. I had them Synced and everything, but upon refreshing Firefox they are all gone. I need them stored in Firefox or I will not be able to login to any of my accounts. The sync function seems to not be working either (unless I am using it wrong). Most were securely generated passwords. Not memorable ones.

I saw that refreshing would remove certain things like extensions, but it said it would keep bookmarks, passwords, etc. I have my booksmarks, just zero passwords. HELP!

I need them for work today. Can you assist please!?

Appreciated, Tyler
creator: twursta

title: how to search the value of preferences in about:config page after Firefox 71?
content: In Firefox 71 and later version, Mozilla introduce a new about:config page style. In the new about:config page, the search bar can only match the name of preferences, but can't match the value of preferences. For example, when I type "https" in the search bar, The old about:config page can list all preferences with "https" in its name and value; but the new about:config page only list the preferences with "https" in its name. It makes user difficult to find the target preferences with specific value. Is there any method to find the target preferences with specific value?
creator: asmreg

title: PDF takes 27 seconds to load
content:
I'm on Firefox 110.0.1 (64-bit) and running in troubleshoot mode. Under settings, I have "Portable Document Format (PDF)" configured to "Open in Firefox". Some PDF documents show up as blank for ~27 seconds, but show up immediately on Chrome.

I've downloaded an installation guide PDF file from the store.ui.com website.

For example, you can look at the doorbell camera: https://store.ui.com/collections/unifi-protect/products/g4-doorbell-pro Then select instructions and manuals to expand the PDF files available.
creator: kennethfy

title: Latest version of Firefox (110.0.1) won't play Toastmasters or MindValley videos
content: Latest version of Firefox (110) on iMac won't play Toastmasters or MindValley videos - Youtube, Netflix, Amazon Prime videos all okay. I checked the settings, all looked okay. Tested Chrome browser - Toastmasters and MindValley videos play okay. Conclusion: Firefox fault, or obscure setting wrong
creator: petermj16

title: Keeper Password Manager Extension for Firefox - Auto logoff feature
content:
The Keeper Password Manager Extension for Firefox is supposed to have a "switch" to turn on the "auto logoff" feature. This, at least, is what the Keeper website says. I have looked at the Keeper extension in Firefox (and made sure it was the current version) but I cannot find any reference to auto logoff. I would like to be able to use this feature (as I am able to do in Chrome.) Any insight to this?

James Beeghly
creator: hopefulflyer

title: Ancestry.com not working entirely with the latest update of Firefox browser
content: Just FYI... for the past few days, I've noticed that my Ancestry.com DNA Matches will not open in Firefox on multiple Windows computers. This function works fine in Chrome on the same computers. In Firefox, the rest of the Ancestry website works without problems. I can navigate to the DNA Matches page where it shows Paternal, Maternal, etc., but when I click on the "View Matches" button, only the header and footer information shows up on the resulting page -- no DNA match data appears. It's almost like the Javascript, or whatever they use, isn't firing. I tried texting Ancestry, and their automated response suggested downloading the latest version of Firefox. I've already done that (version 110.0.1 (64-bit)). I don't know if this problem belongs to you or if it's large enough for you to worry about, but it's annoying to me and I'll have to switch to another browser if this can't be resolved. I'd prefer to stay with Firefox. I didn't notice this problem until the past few days (or maybe a week) or so. I'm wondering if it's anything related to your latest update(s)? Thanks!
creator: dtstaley57

title: Extensions are installed but don't appear in toolbars (v. 110.0.1). Estensiones no aparecen en barras de herramientas

title: View image info without extra request
content:
Hi!

Is it possible to configure firefox so that when I right click image and choose view image info it would not request that image again from server but rather look it up from already downloaded resource? In some cases it can be a problem or even deal breaker if that feature has to make new request just re-download what has already been downloaded.
creator: wybqogzigoxruxdhnp

title: Breaches - Sites I don't have accounts on for approx 99% of them listed
content: Hi there, I was looking through the breach list you all have for my email address and am a bit confused. The companies listed except for a couple are all ones that I do not have accounts on so I don't understand how I ended up on a breach list. Are you able to explain this further and when you reply, would you mind not sending a reply that I cannot reply to if I still have a question (or if the replies are generated with that type of email in the reply field would you mind including an email address that I can reply to so that the individual reading my follow-up question doesn't have to begin from the beginning with my submitting another support request like this but can see what has already been addresses and then hopefully wrap it up? Thanks so much!
creator: tara7175
